fields.name: Monterey
fields.description: Sourced from benchland vineyards situated at the base of the Santa Lucia Highlands, this Pinot Noir has concentrated aromas of red cherry, strawberry and hints of baking spice with dark berry and black tea flavors on the palate. Well-balanced acidity and richness combine with silky tannins to create a long, smooth finish.
fields.tasting_notes: The bright cherry aromas of this brilliant red wine are layered with notes of strawberry and black tea. On the palate, juicy black cherry cola, vanilla, toasted oak and balanced tannins lead to a long, silky finish.

fields.name: Les Cadrans de Lassègue
fields.description: Les Cadrans de Lassègue is a brilliantly clear red Bordeaux wine blend, showing a ruby core and flavors of fresh red fruit. The texture is reflective of its predominant varietal, Merlot, on full display here in its most soft, expansive form. Above all else the wine has balanced fruit. The generous, lifted bouquet, silky texture, and finely integrated tannins make this the perfect wine to enjoy right away.
fields.tasting_notes: This Bordeaux red wine blend shows bright red fruit that leaps out of the glass. Red cherry and red currant notes are accented with spice aromas. Fresh and elegant, the finesse of the Cabernet Franc gives a linear lift on the palate, with refined tannins and a lively and balanced finish.

fields.name: Arcanum Valadorna
fields.description: Made predominately of Merlot, this blend comes from the estates most complex blocks that are often the last to ripen. On the palate, Valadorna is smooth, round, and mouth-filling. Touched with nuances of spicy oak, morello cherries, mission figs, and light violet floral notes.
fields.tasting_notes: This red wine has aromas of black cherries, vanilla and cedar. Flavors of cherry pie and black licorice lead to right acidity and plush tannins, lead to a long finish of white pepper and stony minerality.

fields.name: McLaren Vale
fields.description: From bush vines planted in 1946 high on deep sandy soils, the Yangarra Grenache is complex, elegant and enticing. Winemaker Peter Fraser has a touch that all agree is uncommon: his wines are always incredibly fragrant and textured. This wine doesn't disappoint, offering an exotic, spice-laden nose alongside kirsch, dried flowers and blackberry compote. The palate is all silk with no sharp edges, a wine to enjoy today or age for future enjoyment.
fields.tasting_notes: This wine offers an exotic, spice-laden nose alongside kirsch, dried flowers and blackberry compote. The palate is all silk with no sharp edges, a wine to enjoy today or cellar for future enjoyment.

fields.name: Stagecoach Vineyard
fields.description: The Stagecoach Vineyard has become synonymous with high-elevation grape growing. Located on the outskirts of Napa, wine from this vineyard is dramatically different than made on the valley floor. Red and black fruits mingle brilliantly with fresh red plum, blackberry and blueberry that marry seamlessly with the structure and flavors of espresso bean, dark chocolate and truffle found in this mountain-grown fruit. Sure to make you fall in love with Merlot with every sip.
fields.tasting_notes: In the aroma there is the essence of dried cranberry, red raspberry and Santa Rosa plum. The fruit is integrated with aromatic cedar, coconut, coffee, black pepper with briary nuances of sage and herbal spices. Dark cherry and plum are the primary flavors with a very resolved pleasant tannin structure.

fields.name: Bosché
fields.description: The Bosché Vineyard is arguably one of Napa's most historic vineyards and this wine is a Napa Valley icon. In fact, it was one of the valley’s very first vineyard-designated wines. Showcasing the classic 'Rutherford Dust' profile, this Napa Valley favorite is dense with red and black cherry, dark chocolate, espresso, black pepper, grilled herbs and cigar box. Don't miss your chance to sip on a piece of Napa Valley history.
fields.tasting_notes: This dark red wine has complex aromas of blackberry, cassis, oak spice and cocoa. Balanced acidity and integrated tannins provide a long, complex and minerally finish.

fields.name: Liar's Dice
fields.description: Murphy-Goode's Liar's Dice is a juicy expression of a classic California Zinfandel. Fresh aromatics of vanilla and cedar with juicy flavors of black raspberry, black cherry and blackberry jam. This wine is made to be a second glass Zin! If you have one, you are sure to have a second. Jackpot!
fields.tasting_notes: This juicy red wine has fresh aromas and flavors of black raspberry, black cherry, and blackberry jam. Soft tannins help round out his classic.

fields.name: Colbertina
fields.description: Colbertina Barbera takes its name from Giulia Colbert, an early promoter of the wines of the Langhe. Here, in the Piedmont hills, this grape gives its best expression, filled with scents of wild bergamot, red cherries, dark plums, spice, licorice and cocoa. The palate is fresh and lively, with juicy acidity and gentle tannins. The perfect wine for charcuterie.
fields.tasting_notes: Intense ruby-red colour with violet glints. Ample and complex bouquet with floral tones reminiscent of rose, and pleasant hints of chocolate and vanilla. The flavour is rich and harmonious with a delightful and long lasting aftertaste.

fields.name: The Peake
fields.description: Blending Cabernet Sauvignon and Shiraz is a famous part of Australian winemaking history and whilst the individual components of this red wine are mighty, the sum of The Peake’s parts is magnificent. Hickinbotham The Peake continues to honor the legacy of this iconic Australian blend.
fields.tasting_notes: Deep in color. The rich Shiraz fills out the power of the Cabernet Sauvignon in this red wine blend as dark chocolate, blackberry, shiraz spice, and minerality carry through the balanced finish.

fields.name: Helena Montana
fields.description: We are thrilled to offer this limited release, purchases are limited to 3-bottles. Lush, velvety and opulent, the Helena Montana Cabernet Sauvignon chronicles the terroir at this steep, Knights Valley hillside site. The signature attributes include blackberries, currants, violets, chocolate, spice and licorice. The palate offers deep, expansive flavors supported by soft, silky tannins. This wine shows well in its youth, but will expand and improve with age.
fields.tasting_notes: This red wine has a concentrated, deep red color with aromas of blackberries, currants, violets, chocolate, spice and licorice. The palate offers deep, expansive flavors supported by soft, silky tannins.

fields.name: Monterey
fields.description: A wine known for helping to put Monterey Chardonnays on the map, there's a reason this cult favorite is so popular and can be found in some of the best restaurants to your very own refrigerator. Aromas of Meyer lemon, grilled pineapple, and guava are followed by flavors of nectarine, papaya, and lemon-tangerine, with touches of spice and minerality and a nice lingering, long finish.
fields.tasting_notes: This juicy white wine displays a wonderful array of fruits, with Meyer Lemon, passionfruit and grilled pineapple, which are complemented by a touch of spice and minerality on the palate.

fields.name: Terracea Spring Mountain
fields.description: If you haven’t tried Riesling yet, or if you’re a Riesling lover, this wine is calling your name. This lightly golden elixir is sourced from Napa Valley’s Spring Mountain District. The grapes for this wine were whole-cluster pressed—a technique that maximizes fruit intensity by minimizing the juice’s contact with the skins. The juice was then fermented in a combination of concrete eggs, stainless steel, and new French oak puncheons to create a wine with a silky texture, beautiful acidity, and a mouth-filling palate of ripe stone fruit, honey, and flowers. Bonus: the large-format size makes this the perfect bottle for a celebration, the holidays, or a sweet anniversary gift.
fields.tasting_notes: A nose of honeysuckle, orange blossom, crisp citrus fruits and minerality is followed by touches of white peach and pear.

fields.name: Marlborough
fields.description: This wine displays grapefruit and citrus with overlaying tropical and stone fruit flavors and a gentle herbaceous undercurrent. The palate is quintessentially Marlborough – vibrant, fresh and cleansing with a lovely precise framework carrying the fruit flavors to a long, pure and mouthwatering finish.
fields.tasting_notes: This white wine displays citrus with tropical and stone fruit flavors and herbs. The palate is vibrant and fresh with a lovely structure carrying the fruit flavors to a long, mouthwatering finish.

fields.name: Saralee's Vineyard
fields.description: Richard Arrowood and Saralee Kunde are two pioneers in the California wine industry. Their legacies come together in this single vineyard wine made from the famed 'Wedding Hill' block of vines in the Russian River Valley. Jasmine, honeysuckle, and orange blossom complement notes of white nectarine, honey, and a touch of pear with a supple texture throughout.
fields.tasting_notes: Vibrant floral aromas of honeysuckle and orange blossom explode from the glass, complimenting the fresh stone fruit expression this variety is known for. The palate is rich yet vibrant with flavors of wildflower honey, ripe nectarine, and sweet ginger, offering intriguing texture and lingering flavors that persist in beautiful balance.
fields.origin: Russian River Valley, Sonoma County, CA

fields.name: Chardonnay
fields.description: Hailed by The Drinks Business as the #1 Chardonnay in 2020, this wine rivals nearly any Grand Cru white Burgundy in quality but at a much friendlier price. Its silky texture envelops a core of fresh citrus, toasted oak, peaches, apples, and a saline note. We’re thrilled to sell this rare and exclusive wine, which is normally offered to collectors only once a year.
fields.tasting_notes: This white wine exhibits aromas of lemon, lily, white truffle and vanilla, which are tantalizing with lemon, tree fruits and saline flavors. Luscious texture and balanced, bright acidity.

fields.name: Willamette Valley
fields.description: This rosé explodes with aromas of strawberry, grapefruit, and Key lime. Lively effervescence creates a fun and playful texture in the mouth. Enjoy a slight spritz and fresh flavors of just ripe early summer fruits.
fields.tasting_notes: This wine has delicate aromas of cherry blossom, hibiscus and rose blending with notes of watermelon and citrus.

fields.name: Saralee's Vineyard
fields.description: When grapes are so good you have to make a single vineyard Rosé! It is rare to find, but La Crema likes to showcase the very best and this wine from their home at Saralee's Vineyard is now a fruity, crisp, classic. Made from Pinot Noir, these are the first grapes harvested in the Russian River Valley to maintain juicy acidity found in cool regions.
fields.tasting_notes: Aromas and flavors of nectarine, strawberry, fresh watermelon, white cherry, and lime zest pop from the glass.
fields.origin: Russian River Valley, Sonoma County, CA

fields.name: Les Voisins
fields.description: This rosé is made from Pinot Noir grapes grown in remote, coastal vineyards in rugged Mendocino County. Aromatics and flavors of pink grapefruit, strawberry, white peach and freshly plucked rose petals leave you wanting another sip. Versatile when it comes to cuisines and always a popular pick, this is the perfect summer wine.
fields.tasting_notes: Made entirely from Pinot Noir, this rosé pink wine exhibits complex aromas and flavors of watermelon, citrus blossoms, and stone fruits. Savory, dry and a great accompaniment to a broad range of cuisine.

fields.name: Alexander Valley
fields.description: Looking for a truly one-of-a-kind rosé? This is it. Planted over 50 years ago in Alexander Valley's historic Field Stone Vineyard, only three rows of Sangiovese remain and 100% of it goes right to this now legendary wine. Thanks to fermenting in cold stainless steel, this dry, pale pink rosé retains its freshness and acidity while offering up tons of aromatics, rose petal and melon with hints of strawberry and wild cherry.
fields.tasting_notes: Aromas of watermelon, melon, guava, red cherry, and raspberry. Juicy flavors of peach, stone fruit, watermelon, and strawberry with nice minerality. Bright acidity and a long, dry finish.

fields.name: Julia's Vineyard
fields.description: Certified sustainable and crafted with intention, Cambria specifically grows a portion of their estate pinot noir for this lively, single-vineyard rosé. Beautifully hued and always refreshing, this exuberant wine is full of fresh strawberry, watermelon, and citrus with a crisp finish leading to the inevitable longing for another glass. Or let's be serious, another bottle.
fields.tasting_notes: As one of the Flagships of our portfolio– and a Team Cambria favorite– our estate rosé has aromas of fresh strawberry, watermelon, and citrus. It's dry and perfectly pink with a smooth texture, bright acidity, and a tart finish.
fields.origin: Santa Maria Valley, Santa Barbara County, CA

fields.name: Friuli Prosecco
fields.description: Who doesn't love a glass of Prosecco? Benvolio's version is sourced from the vineyards of Friuli in Northeast Italy. Filled with scents of orchard fruits, lemony citrus, and a touch of honeysuckle, this bubbly is sure to please even the most discerning of drinkers. It's light, refreshing, and crisp. Perfect for brunch or with a plate of prosciutto and melon.
fields.tasting_notes: Benvolio Prosécco sparkling wine is a true expression of Italian prosécco wine and the renowned Friuli region’s terroir – the vibrant, crisp acidity acts as a counterpoint to the flavors of ripe citrus, fresh peaches, lemon, green apples, and grapefruit. The finish is light, refreshing, and crisp.
fields.origin: Santa Maria Valley, Santa Barbara County, CA

fields.name: Yamhill-Carlton
fields.description: Oregon Sparkling Wine has entered the chat. Winemaker Shane Moore uses some of the Willamette Valley's finest Chardonnay and Pinot Noir grapes to craft his traditional method sparkling brut rosé. This single-vineyard bubbly features fine, delicate bubbles, racy acidity, and flavors of lemon, raspberry, brioche and subtle spice. It's as close to Champagne as you can get without dusting off your passport and crossing the pond.
fields.tasting_notes: Balanced fatness and acidity, vibrant and exceptionally clean all the way through to the finish, phenomenally precise.

fields.name: Sonoma County
fields.description: Our first Sparkling Wine is a beautiful Brut Rosé — a blend of Pinot Noir and Chardonnay from our favorite cool-climate vineyards in Sonoma County. The fruit is picked relatively early to preserve the natural vibrant acidity and lively fresh fruit character. Pinot Noir provides elegant red fruit flavors, a touch of color, and the wine’s delicate texture. Chardonnay is the perfect complement, adding structure and notes of stone fruit, cream, and apples. The blend was aged for eight years, adding complexity, and contributing an overall delicacy to the wine. The wine is then disgorged and a dosage is added back to balance the wine’s acidity. The resulting “méthode traditionnelle” sparkling wine showcases delicate bubbles, bright acidity, and beautifully layered flavors — a perfect addition to any celebration.
fields.tasting_notes: The palate is delightful with a natural acidity that lingers in the mouth. The age of this wine results in layers of creaminess, balanced acidity, and an elegant sparkling crown with fine bubbles Serve chilled at 50-54° to accentuate the natural acidity. Slightly warmer brings out a fuller mouthfeel and riper fruit character of mangos, peaches, and tropical fruit. Pair with a Straw- berry Bavarian Cream dessert for a delectable treat!

fields.name: Friuli Prosecco
fields.description: Who doesn't love a glass of Prosecco? Benvolio's version is sourced from the vineyards of Friuli in Northeast Italy. Filled with scents of orchard fruits, lemony citrus, and a touch of honeysuckle, this bubbly is sure to please even the most discerning of drinkers. It's light, refreshing, and crisp. Perfect for brunch or with a plate of prosciutto and melon.
fields.tasting_notes: Benvolio Prosécco sparkling wine is a true expression of Italian prosécco wine and the renowned Friuli region’s terroir – the vibrant, crisp acidity acts as a counterpoint to the flavors of ripe citrus, fresh peaches, lemon, green apples, and grapefruit. The finish is light, refreshing, and crisp.
fields.origin: Santa Maria Valley, Santa Barbara County, CA
